TopicTitle: The 0.25 Waiting Room, now boarding passengers heading to Hypetown

Articles.Content:
And it's 9 pm squad time... Also I'm not getting any of the issues mentioned.

EDIT: Though, steamDB is updating pretty rapidly, which is unusual for this time of night. Are they rushing or what? I hope some horrible bug hasn't come up...

Wheres the link to the SteamDB?
www.steamdb.info/app/220200

I'm wondering how gameplay without the tracking station will work. I guess we wont be able to click on it and get a map, but will map view on craft still work?

That's what I'm assuming. If I literally can't use map mode, I'll see what I can do to play without it. may be fun for a little while at least while I frantically get contracts for cash, or it could become a huge pain.

Seriously.. I haven't played KSP for 2 weeks.. because I wanted to take a few day break before the new update so it would feel fresh.. If I knew it wasn't going to be released for more then a week I wouldn't of taken that break. I'm getting quite bored because I had nothing very fun to do for the past week or so. I wasn't expecting them to take so gosh darn long for an update..

LOL you either weren't here for the 0.23.5 -> 0.24 update, or you caught a nasty case of selective amnesia. There was a 2-3 week delay between the media blitz (which I think was larger than this one) and release. Plus, there was some screw-up in communication with youtubers that led to the community being led to believe that the release should have already happened by the time the videos went up.

We basically just had to put up with SQUAD vomitting the line "Soon" at the community for a couple weeks and then blaming the community for the hype and disappointment.

This time around, there will [probably] only be a few days between the media hype and the release so don't get too worked up about the wait time. It's way better than it was the last time around.

Updates come when they do. I would *much* rather Squad nailed everything down they could, then releasing an update that isn't finished just because it was getting near what people imagined to be the release date.

In an age of zero-day patches, that's *praiseworthy* rather than a source for complaint.
Well I just officially somehow broke my save and apparently the only way to salvage it is to not recover or terminate any of my probes. I don't even. So, come on .25. lol

Updates come when they do. I would *much* rather Squad nailed everything down they could, then releasing an update that isn't finished just because it was getting near what people imagined to be the release date.

In an age of zero-day patches, that's *praiseworthy* rather than a source for complaint.

Are there any words on smaller control surfaces, and whether or not they'll be phased out? If they are, I'll loose most of my interest in KSP.

0.24 career mode successfully "ended". All Kerbals returned to KSC, stations deorbited with beautiful fireworks, some sats shattered on the bodies they were observing.

Jeb, Bill & Bob are boarding the hype-train hmmmmm, "vessel"

0.25 here we come!

Yeah I know, the hype is unbearable. I'm waiting for the moment when the hypevessel explodes in a nice explosion, with 0.25 emerging from the ashes.

It is Tuesday. How close is zero-hour? xD
